IndicatorLabelTable: Economic Inequality
IndicatorDescription: A sub-component of the fragile states index, The economic inequality indicator considers inequality within the economy, irrespective of the actual performance of an economy. For example, the Indicator looks at structural inequality that is based on group (such as racial, ethnic, religious, or other identity group) or based on education, economic status, or region (such as urban-rural divide). It also takes into account perceived inequalities that can cause grievances among vulnerable populations.

IndicatorLabelTable: Inequality-adjusted HDI

DataKey: Inequality-adjusted HDI
